page.title: 16WORK ON THE FARM
page.content: MY DAD WORKS ON A FARM. HIS DAY BEGINS AT 6 O'CLOCK IN THE MORNING WHEN HE GOES TO MR. ROBERTS, THE FARM MANAGER, TO SEE WHAT WORK HE HAS TO DO THAT DAY. HE MIGHT HAVE TO MEND THE TRACTORS OR FARM MACHINERY, OR CLEAN OUT THE COW PENS. HE ALSO GETS THE FORK LIFT TRUCK TO CLEAR THE MUCK AND TAKE IT AWAY ON THE TRAILER. HE DRIVES A TRACTOR TO PLOUGH THE FIELDS, AND IN SUMMER HE DRIVES THE COMBINE HARVESTER. HE STOPS FOR LUNCH BETWEEN 12 NOON AND 1p.m. AND HIS WORK DAY USUALLY FINISHES AT 4.30p.m. HE HAS MOST WEEKENDS OFF BUT ALL THE FARM WORKERS TAKE TURNS TO FEED THE COWS ON SATURDAYS AND SUNDAYS. WE LIVE IN A COTTAGE ON THE FARM SO MY DAD DOESN'T HAVE FAR TO GO TO WORK BUT IF HE LEAVES HIS JOB WE HAVE TO LEAVE OUR HOME BECAUSE THE HOUSE GOES WITH THE JOB.
